original_data.question:
A 10-year-old boy is brought to his pediatrician after discovering a painless mass in the left testicle. Results from tumor markers and a biopsy are as follows:
AFP 350 ng/mL (normal value < 10 ng/mL)
hCG 0.4 IU/L (normal value < 0.5 IU/L)
Biopsy: Presence of glomeruli-like structures with a central capillary within a mesodermal core, lined by flattened layers of germ cells.
What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

model_response:
The presence of glomeruli-like structures with a central capillary within a mesodermal core, lined by flattened layers of germ cells, is characteristic of teratoma. Teratomas are composed of a variety of parenchymal cell types that are derived from one or more of the 3 germ layers. They are composed of tissues such as hair, muscle, and cailage. Teratomas are typically mature and benign.

The other choices are not correct. Classic seminomas are composed of sheets of uniform polygonal or round cells with clear cytoplasm and central nuclei. Choriocarcinoma is a highly malignant tumor that is composed of cytotrophoblasts and syncytiotrophoblasts. Yolk sac tumor is composed of cells that resemble those in the primitive yolk sac.

###Answer: OPTION C IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: A medical doctor with specialized training in the care of children.
The testis on the left side of the body.

A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations.
Removal and pathologic examination of specimens from the living body.
The range or frequency distribution of a measurement in a population (of organisms, organs or things) that has not been selected for the presence of disease or abnormality.
The range or frequency distribution of a measurement in a population (of organisms, organs or things) that has not been selected for the presence of disease or abnormality.
A cluster of convoluted capillaries beginning at each nephric tubule in the kidney and held together by connective tissue.
The minute vessels that connect arterioles and venules.
The center of an object; indispensable
A relatively thin sheetlike expanse or region lying over or under another.
The reproductive cells in multicellular organisms at various stages during GAMETOGENESIS.

The determination of the nature of a disease or condition, or the distinguishing of one disease or condition from another. Assessment may be made through physical examination, laboratory tests, or the likes. Computerized programs may be used to enhance the decision-making process.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
